name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: We will continue to prioritize Oregon’s seniors, people with underlying health conditions, frontline workers, and those Oregonians most vulnerable to COVID-19 to make sure they are at the front of the line.

name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: The House just passed the #AmericanRescuePlan, bringing us one step closer to providing Oregon families and business owners with the additional COVID-19 relief they need. I look forward to @POTUS signing this important piece of legislation into law.

name: Governor Kate Brown

tweet: Oregonians need additional relief to deal with the impacts of COVID-19. Thanks to Sen. @RonWyden & @SenJeffMerkley for their work to pass @POTUS's #AmericanRescuePlan. I look forward to President Biden signing it into law.

name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: Today, I announced my executive order to return Oregon public school students to the classroom.  The science is clear: with proper safety measures in place, there is a low risk of COVID-19 transmission in school.

tweet: Oregonians must remain vigilant when it comes to protecting themselves and their communities from COVID-19. Keep wearing face coverings, washing your hands, and avoiding indoor gatherings.

tweet: Oregon has administered over 1 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines. tweet: With vaccine efforts ramping up, the light at the end of the tunnel grows closer each day.   We are reopening school buildings and businesses.   But we must keep up our guard, with new, more contagious COVID-19 variants circulating in the U.S., including in Oregon.

name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: With a 3rd safe and effective COVID-19 vaccine now authorized by the @US_FDA, one which takes only a single shot to protect those who receive it, we will keep distributing vaccines quickly & equitably until all Oregonians who want a vaccine can have one.  https://t.co/VesV6KgDd0

tweet: Come summer, provided supplies from the federal government continue as planned, any Oregonian over 16 who wants the vaccine will be eligible to receive it.  By June 1: any Oregonian 45 and older will be eligible for the COVID-19 vaccine By July 1: all Oregonians 16+

name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: Beginning March 29, the next group of Oregonians will become eligible for the COVID-19 vaccine: adults aged 45-64 with one or more underlying health conditions and other seasonal frontline workers.

name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: But now is not the time to let up our guard. New COVID-19 variants are circulating in U.S., including several confirmed cases in Oregon.

name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: Our COVID-19 rates are some of the lowest in the country. We helped health care workers during the winter surge, and critical care units are now seeing fewer & fewer patients. We are reopening schools and businesses, and we have vaccinated hundreds of thousands of Oregonians.

name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: When I issued this declaration last March, there were 14 known cases of COVID-19 in Oregon. Now, we have seen more than 150,000 cases, and, sadly, 2,194 deaths. But Oregonians have made smart choices that have protected our families and loved ones and saved thousands of lives.

name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: In December, many doubted in-person elementary school was within reach. But thanks to Oregonians’ smart choices, COVID-19 cases, hospitalizations, and deaths declined. Now even our largest districts meet or exceed advisory metrics for hybrid in-person instruction.

name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: The science is clear: with proper health and safety protocols in place, there is very little risk of COVID-19 transmission in schools. As districts implement safety protocols, we can reopen our school buildings in a way that protects students, staff, and our communities.

name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: School sports promote students’ mental and physical health. As COVID-19 numbers drop, we'll proceed with caution. name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: As we mark nearly a year since Oregon’s first COVID-19 case, today we hit a grim milestone of crossing past 2,000 COVID-19 related deaths. Each life lost is one too many. I know each number is someone’s parent, child, best friend or colleague. And my thoughts are with them.

name: Governor Kate Brown

tweet: In a pandemic, Oregonians must have access to timely info to keep themselves & their families safe. I have directed @OHAOregon to disclose all data on COVID-19 deaths weekly, including the date the individual tested positive, their age, location & underlying health conditions.

name: Governor Kate Brown
tweet: Good things happened this week:   ✅ Finally — a strong national COVID-19 plan ✅Protections for DACA ✅Recommitting to the Paris climate agreement ✅An end to the Muslim ban  ... the future is looking brighter
